channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: What happened when Lyndon Johnson federalized the National Guard
item.description: President Lyndon B. Johnson federalized the National Guard in 1965, calling on troops to protect civil rights advocates who were marching from Selma, Ala., to Montgomery.
item.content:encoded:
President Lyndon B. Johnson federalized the National Guard in 1965, calling on troops to protect civil rights advocates who were marching from Selma, Ala., to Montgomery.

(Image credit: William Lovelace)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: Trump mobilizes Marines and more National Guard troops for duty in LA
item.description: U.S. Northern Command says the infantry battalion would be supporting the National Guard troops "who are protecting federal personnel and federal property in the greater Los Angeles area."
item.content:encoded:
U.S. Northern Command says the infantry battalion would be supporting the National Guard troops "who are protecting federal personnel and federal property in the greater Los Angeles area."

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Tom Bowman

item.title: RFK Jr. boots all members of the CDC's vaccine advisory committee
item.description: Health Secretary RFK Jr. has removed all 17 members of the CDC's Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices. He says replacing them with new members will help restore 'public trust' in vaccines.
item.content:encoded:
Health Secretary RFK Jr. has removed all 17 members of the CDC's Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices. He says replacing them with new members will help restore 'public trust' in vaccines.

(Image credit: Tasos Katopodis)
item.dc:creator: Will Stone

item.title: Students from India and China Rethink Studying in the U.S.
item.description: The United States hosts many students and scientific researchers from the world's two largest countries, India and China. The U.S. is seen as one of the best places to get and education and on the cutting edge of innovation. But a series of moves by the Trump administration, including greater scrutiny of those applying for student visa and, in the case of China, threats to revoke some visas, are making some rethink their plans.
item.content:encoded: The United States hosts many students and scientific researchers from the world's two largest countries, India and China. The U.S. is seen as one of the best places to get and education and on the cutting edge of innovation. But a series of moves by the Trump administration, including greater scrutiny of those applying for student visa and, in the case of China, threats to revoke some visas, are making some rethink their plans.
item.dc:creator: Omkar Khandekar

item.title: Justin Baldoni's $400 million defamation suit against Blake Lively dismissed
item.description: Baldoni's $400 million lawsuit was in response to Lively accusing him of sexual harassment on the set of It Ends With Us.
item.content:encoded:
It Ends With Us co-star Blake Lively failed to show actual malice.'/>

Baldoni's $400 million lawsuit was in response to Lively accusing him of sexual harassment on the set of It Ends With Us.

(Image credit: Cindy Ord)
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: Sly Stone, visionary funk frontman of the Family Stone, has died at age 82
item.description: The musical visionary led a multi-racial funk band that produced five Top 10 hits in the late 1960s and early '70s.
item.content:encoded:
The musical visionary led a multi-racial funk band that produced five Top 10 hits in the late 1960s and early '70s.

(Image credit: Ellis Herwig)
item.dc:creator: Brandon Gates

item.title: Pam Bondi's brother overwhelmingly defeated in heated race to lead the D.C. Bar
item.description: The race became a microcosm for the clashes and pressures on the American legal system this year, in part because one of the two top candidates is the younger brother of Attorney General Pam Bondi.
item.content:encoded:
The race became a microcosm for the clashes and pressures on the American legal system this year, in part because one of the two top candidates is the younger brother of Attorney General Pam Bondi.

(Image credit: ftwitty)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: Low turnout scuttles Italy referendum on citizenship
item.description: The referendum, which sought to reduce the time it takes to become a naturalized citizen from 10 years to five, failed because fewer than 50% of eligible voters took part in two days of voting.
item.content:encoded:
The referendum, which sought to reduce the time it takes to become a naturalized citizen from 10 years to five, failed because fewer than 50% of eligible voters took part in two days of voting.

(Image credit: FILIPPO MONTEFORTE)
item.dc:creator: Ruth Sherlock

item.title: Trump's travel ban is now in effect. Here's what to know
item.description: The ban, which revives a controversial measure from Trump's first term, took effect Monday morning. Here's what to know about who's affected, who's exempt and how foreign leaders are responding.
item.content:encoded:
The ban, which revives a controversial measure from Trump's first term, took effect Monday morning. Here's what to know about who's affected, who's exempt and how foreign leaders are responding.

(Image credit: Yuki Iwamura)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Warner Bros. Discovery to be split, as Zaslav retreats from grand ambitions
item.description: Warner Bros. Discovery is to split into two, separating streaming and studios from its cable channels. The company has been burdened by debt and the decline of cable TV.
item.content:encoded:
Warner Bros. Discovery is to split into two, separating streaming and studios from its cable channels. The company has been burdened by debt and the decline of cable TV.

(Image credit: Slaven Vlasic/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik
